om.administration
Class AdministrationDisplayRequestHandler

java.lang.Object
  om.AbstractRequestHandler
      om.administration.AdministrationDisplayRequestHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, RequestHandler, GracefulFinalization
public class AdministrationDisplayRequestHandler
extends AbstractRequestHandler

Provides for rendering out the requestHandling.xml configuration settings so to provide them as options on the administration home page.

Author:
Trevor Hinson
See Also:

renderRequestHandlerSettings

protected java.lang.String renderRequestHandlerSettings(RequestAssociates associates,
                                                        RequestManagement rm)
                                                 throws RequestHandlingException
Renders to a StringBuffer the details of the RequestHandlers so that they can be displayed within the Administration screen so to be able to invoke them. This is achieved by iterating over all of the configured RequestHandlers.

Parameters:
rm -
Returns:
Throws:
RequestHandlingException

renderRequestHandlerSettings

protected java.lang.StringBuffer renderRequestHandlerSettings(java.lang.String contextPath,
                                                              RequestHandlerSettings rhs)
Renders an individual RequestHandlerSettings to an xhtml format for displaying on the administration screen. Note that each of the invocationPath, displayName, description and contextPath need to be present and valid in the requestHandling.xml for it to be rendered here.

Parameters:
contextPath -
rhs -
Returns:

close

public FinalizedResponse close(java.lang.Object o)
                        throws UtilityException
Description copied from interface: GracefulFinalization
Simple template for the closing of resources within given implementations this method should then be invoked before disposal of the implementor. Where waiting for the finalize method on an implementor is either not sufficient or valid / appropriate. Ensure to invoke the implementation at teh appropriate point also !
